1 'use strict';
  2 
  3 var _ = require('underscore');
  4 
  5 /*global _: false, $: false, localStorage: false, process: true,
  6   XMLHttpRequest: false, XDomainRequest: false, exports: false,
  7   require: false */
  8 module.exports = function(AV) {
  9   /**
 10    * Contains all AV API classes and functions.
 11    * @name AV
 12    * @namespace
 13    *
 14    * Contains all AV API classes and functions.
 15    */
 16 
 17   // If jQuery or Zepto has been included, grab a reference to it.
 18   if (typeof($) !== "undefined") {
 19     AV.$ = $;
 20   }
 21 
 22   // Helpers
 23   // -------
 24 
 25   // Shared empty constructor function to aid in prototype-chain creation.
 26   var EmptyConstructor = function() {};
 27 
 28 
 29   // Helper function to correctly set up the prototype chain, for subclasses.
 30   // Similar to `goog.inherits`, but uses a hash of prototype properties and
 31   // class properties to be extended.
 32   var inherits = function(parent, protoProps, staticProps) {
 33     var child;
 34 
 35     // The constructor function for the new subclass is either defined by you
 36     // (the "constructor" property in your `extend` definition), or defaulted
 37     // by us to simply call the parent's constructor.
 38     if (protoProps && protoProps.hasOwnProperty('constructor')) {
 39       child = protoProps.constructor;
 40     } else {
 41       /** @ignore */
 42       child = function(){ parent.apply(this, arguments); };
 43     }
 44 
 45     // Inherit class (static) properties from parent.
 46     AV._.extend(child, parent);
 47 
 48     // Set the prototype chain to inherit from `parent`, without calling
 49     // `parent`'s constructor function.
 50     EmptyConstructor.prototype = parent.prototype;
 51     child.prototype = new EmptyConstructor();
 52 
 53     // Add prototype properties (instance properties) to the subclass,
 54     // if supplied.
 55     if (protoProps) {
 56       AV._.extend(child.prototype, protoProps);
 57     }
 58 
 59     // Add static properties to the constructor function, if supplied.
 60     if (staticProps) {
 61       AV._.extend(child, staticProps);
 62     }
 63 
 64     // Correctly set child's `prototype.constructor`.
 65     child.prototype.constructor = child;
 66 
 67     // Set a convenience property in case the parent's prototype is
 68     // needed later.
 69     child.__super__ = parent.prototype;
 70 
 71     return child;
 72   };
 73 
 74   // Set the server for AV to talk to.
 75   AV.serverURL = "https://api.leancloud.cn";
 76 
 77   // Check whether we are running in Node.js.
 78   if (typeof(process) !== "undefined" &&
 79       process.versions &&
 80       process.versions.node) {
 81     AV._isNode = true;
 82   }
 83 
 84   /**
 85    * Call this method first to set up your authentication tokens for AV.
 86    * You can get your keys from the Data Browser on avoscloud.com.
 87    * @param {String} applicationId Your AV Application ID.
 88    * @param {String} applicationKey Your AV JavaScript Key.
 89    * @param {String} masterKey (optional) Your AVOSCloud Master Key. (Node.js only!).
 90    */
 91   AV.initialize = function(applicationId, applicationKey, masterKey) {
 92     if (masterKey) {
 93       throw new Error("AV.initialize() was passed a Master Key, which is only " +
 94         "allowed from within Node.js.");
 95     }
 96     AV._initialize(applicationId, applicationKey,masterKey);
 97   };
 98 
 99   /**
100    * Call this method first to set up authentication tokens for AV.
101    * This method is for AV's own private use.
102    * @param {String} applicationId Your AV Application ID.
103    * @param {String} applicationKey Your AV Application Key
104    */
105    AV._initialize = function(applicationId, applicationKey, masterKey) {
106     if (AV.applicationId !== undefined &&
107         applicationId !== AV.applicationId  &&
108         applicationKey !== AV.applicationKey &&
109         masterKey !== AV.masterKey) {
110       console.warn('AVOSCloud SDK is already initialized, please don\'t reinitialize it.');
111     }
112     AV.applicationId = applicationId;
113     AV.applicationKey = applicationKey;
114     AV.masterKey = masterKey;
115     AV._useMasterKey = false;
116   };
117 
118 
119   /**
120    * Call this method to set production environment variable.
121    * @param {Boolean} production True is production environment,and
122    *  it's true by default.
123    */
124   AV.setProduction = function(production){
125     if(!AV._isNullOrUndefined(production)) {
126       //make sure it's a number
127       production = production ? 1 : 0;
128     }
129     //default is 1
130     AV.applicationProduction = AV._isNullOrUndefined(production) ? 1: production;
131   };
132 
133   // If we're running in node.js, allow using the master key.
134   if (AV._isNode) {
135     AV.initialize = AV._initialize;
136 
137     AV.Cloud = AV.Cloud || {};
138     /**
139      * Switches the AVOSCloud SDK to using the Master key.  The Master key grants
140      * priveleged access to the data in AVOSCloud and can be used to bypass ACLs and
141      * other restrictions that are applied to the client SDKs.
142      * <p><strong><em>Available in Cloud Code and Node.js only.</em></strong>
143      * </p>
144      */
145     AV.Cloud.useMasterKey = function() {
146       AV._useMasterKey = true;
147     };
148   }

152     *Use china avoscloud API service:https://cn.avoscloud.com
153     */
154    AV.useAVCloudCN = function(){
155     AV.serverURL = "https://leancloud.cn";
156    };

158    /**
159     *Use USA avoscloud API service:https://us.avoscloud.com
160     */
161    AV.useAVCloudUS = function(){
162     AV.serverURL = "https://us-api.leancloud.cn";
163    };

165   /**
166    * Returns prefix for localStorage keys used by this instance of AV.
167    * @param {String} path The relative suffix to append to it.
168    *     null or undefined is treated as the empty string.
169    * @return {String} The full key name.
170    */
171   AV._getAVPath = function(path) {
172     if (!AV.applicationId) {
173       throw "You need to call AV.initialize before using AV.";
174     }
175     if (!path) {
176       path = "";
177     }
178     if (!AV._.isString(path)) {
179       throw "Tried to get a localStorage path that wasn't a String.";
180     }
181     if (path[0] === "/") {
182       path = path.substring(1);
183     }
184     return "AV/" + AV.applicationId + "/" + path;
185   };
186 
187   /**
188    * Returns the unique string for this app on this machine.
189    * Gets reset when localStorage is cleared.
190    */
191   AV._installationId = null;
192   AV._getInstallationId = function() {
193     // See if it's cached in RAM.
194     if (AV._installationId) {
195       return AV.Promise.as(AV._installationId);
196     }
197 
198     // Try to get it from localStorage.
199     var path = AV._getAVPath("installationId");
200     return AV.localStorage.getItemAsync(path).then(function(_installationId){
201       AV._installationId = _installationId;
202       if (!AV._installationId) {
203         // It wasn't in localStorage, so create a new one.
204         var hexOctet = function() {
205           return Math.floor((1+Math.random())*0x10000).toString(16).substring(1);
206         };
207         AV._installationId = (
208           hexOctet() + hexOctet() + "-" +
209           hexOctet() + "-" +
210           hexOctet() + "-" +
211           hexOctet() + "-" +
212           hexOctet() + hexOctet() + hexOctet());
213         return AV.localStorage.setItemAsync(path, AV._installationId);
214       }
215       else {
216         return _installationId;
217       }
218     });
219   };
220 
221   AV._parseDate = function(iso8601) {
222     var regexp = new RegExp(
223       "^([0-9]{1,4})-([0-9]{1,2})-([0-9]{1,2})" + "T" +
224       "([0-9]{1,2}):([0-9]{1,2}):([0-9]{1,2})" +
225       "(.([0-9]+))?" + "Z$");
226     var match = regexp.exec(iso8601);
227     if (!match) {
228       return null;
229     }
230 
231     var year = match[1] || 0;
232     var month = (match[2] || 1) - 1;
233     var day = match[3] || 0;
234     var hour = match[4] || 0;
235     var minute = match[5] || 0;
236     var second = match[6] || 0;
237     var milli = match[8] || 0;
238 
239     return new Date(Date.UTC(year, month, day, hour, minute, second, milli));
240   };
241 
242   AV._ajaxIE8 = function(method, url, data) {
243     var promise = new AV.Promise();
244     var xdr = new XDomainRequest();
245     xdr.onload = function() {
246       var response;
247       try {
248         response = JSON.parse(xdr.responseText);
249       } catch (e) {
250         promise.reject(e);
251       }
252       if (response) {
253         promise.resolve(response);
254       }
255     };
256     xdr.onerror = xdr.ontimeout = function() {
257       // Let's fake a real error message.
258       var fakeResponse = {
259         responseText: JSON.stringify({
260           code: AV.Error.X_DOMAIN_REQUEST,
261           error: "IE's XDomainRequest does not supply error info."
262         })
263       };
264       promise.reject(xdr);
265     };
266     xdr.onprogress = function() {};
267     xdr.open(method, url);
268     xdr.send(data);
269     return promise;
270   };
271 
272    AV._useXDomainRequest = function() {
273        if (typeof(XDomainRequest) !== "undefined") {
274            // We're in IE 8+.
275            if ('withCredentials' in new XMLHttpRequest()) {
276                // We're in IE 10+.
277                return false;
278            }
279            return true;
280        }
281        return false;
282    };
283 
284   AV._ajax = function(method, url, data, success, error) {
285     var options = {
286       success: success,
287       error: error
288     };
289 
290     if (AV._useXDomainRequest()) {
291       return AV._ajaxIE8(method, url, data)._thenRunCallbacks(options);
292     }
293 
294     var promise = new AV.Promise();
295     var handled = false;
296 
297     var xhr = new AV.XMLHttpRequest();
298     xhr.onreadystatechange = function() {
299       if (xhr.readyState === 4) {
300         if (handled) {
301           return;
302         }
303         handled = true;
304 
305         if (xhr.status >= 200 && xhr.status < 300) {
306           var response;
307           try {
308             response = JSON.parse(xhr.responseText);
309           } catch (e) {
310             promise.reject(e);
311           }
312           if (response) {
313             promise.resolve(response, xhr.status, xhr);
314           }
315         } else {
316           promise.reject(xhr);
317         }
318       }
319     };
320     xhr.open(method, url, true);
321     xhr.setRequestHeader("Content-Type", "text/plain");  // avoid pre-flight.
322     if (AV._isNode) {
323       // Add a special user agent just for request from node.js.
324       xhr.setRequestHeader("User-Agent",
325                            "AV/" + AV.VERSION +
326                            " (NodeJS " + process.versions.node + ")");
327     }
328     xhr.send(data);
329     return promise._thenRunCallbacks(options);
330   };
331 
332   // A self-propagating extend function.
333   AV._extend = function(protoProps, classProps) {
334     var child = inherits(this, protoProps, classProps);
335     child.extend = this.extend;
336     return child;
337   };
338 
339   /**
340    * route is classes, users, login, etc.
341    * objectId is null if there is no associated objectId.
342    * method is the http method for the REST API.
343    * dataObject is the payload as an object, or null if there is none.
344    * @ignore
345    */
346   AV._request = function(route, className, objectId, method, dataObject) {
347     if (!AV.applicationId) {
348       throw "You must specify your applicationId using AV.initialize";
349     }
350 
351     if (!AV.applicationKey && !AV.masterKey) {
352       throw "You must specify a key using AV.initialize";
353     }
354 
355 
356     if (route !== "batch" &&
357         route !== "classes" &&
358         route !== "files" &&
359         route !== "date" &&
360         route !== "functions" &&
361         route !== "login" &&
362         route !== "push" &&
363         route !== "search/select" &&
364         route !== "requestPasswordReset" &&
365         route !== "requestEmailVerify" &&
366         route !== "requestPasswordResetBySmsCode" &&
367         route !== "resetPasswordBySmsCode" &&
368         route !== "requestMobilePhoneVerify" &&
369         route !== "requestLoginSmsCode" &&
370         route !== "verifyMobilePhone" &&
371         route !== "requestSmsCode" &&
372         route !== "verifySmsCode" &&
373         route !== "users" &&
374         route !== "usersByMobilePhone" &&
375         route !== "cloudQuery" &&
376         route !== "qiniu" &&
377         route !== "statuses" &&
378         route !== "bigquery" &&
379         route !== 'search/select' &&
380         route !== 'subscribe/statuses/count' &&
381         route !== 'subscribe/statuses' &&
382         !(/users\/[^\/]+\/updatePassword/.test(route)) &&
383         !(/users\/[^\/]+\/friendship\/[^\/]+/.test(route))) {
384       throw "Bad route: '" + route + "'.";
385     }
386 
387     var url = AV.serverURL;
388     if (url.charAt(url.length - 1) !== "/") {
389       url += "/";
390     }
391     url += "1.1/" + route;
392     if (className) {
393       url += "/" + className;
394     }
395     if (objectId) {
396       url += "/" + objectId;
397     }
398     if ((route ==='users' || route === 'classes') && dataObject && dataObject._fetchWhenSave){
399       delete dataObject._fetchWhenSave;
400       url += '?new=true';
401     }
402 
403     dataObject = AV._.clone(dataObject || {});
404     if (method !== "POST") {
405       dataObject._method = method;
406       method = "POST";
407     }
408 
409     dataObject._ApplicationId = AV.applicationId;
410     dataObject._ApplicationKey = AV.applicationKey;
411     if(!AV._isNullOrUndefined(AV.applicationProduction)) {
412       dataObject._ApplicationProduction = AV.applicationProduction;
413     }
414     if(AV._useMasterKey)
415         dataObject._MasterKey = AV.masterKey;
416     dataObject._ClientVersion = AV.VERSION;
417     // Pass the session token on every request.
418     var currentUser = AV.User.current();
419     if (currentUser && currentUser._sessionToken) {
420       dataObject._SessionToken = currentUser._sessionToken;
421     }
422 
423     return AV._getInstallationId().then(function(_InstallationId) {
424       dataObject._InstallationId = _InstallationId;
425     }).then(function() {
426       var data = JSON.stringify(dataObject);
427       return AV._ajax(method, url, data).then(null, function(response) {
428         // Transform the error into an instance of AV.Error by trying to parse
429         // the error string as JSON.
430         var error;
431         if (response && response.responseText) {
432           try {
433             var errorJSON = JSON.parse(response.responseText);
434             if (errorJSON) {
435               error = new AV.Error(errorJSON.code, errorJSON.error);
436             }
437           } catch (e) {
438             // If we fail to parse the error text, that's okay.
439           }
440         }
441         error = error || new AV.Error(-1, response.responseText);
442         // By explicitly returning a rejected Promise, this will work with
443         // either jQuery or Promises/A semantics.
444         return AV.Promise.error(error);
445       });
446     });
447   };
448 
449   // Helper function to get a value from a Backbone object as a property
450   // or as a function.
451   AV._getValue = function(object, prop) {
452     if (!(object && object[prop])) {
453       return null;
454     }
455     return AV._.isFunction(object[prop]) ? object[prop]() : object[prop];
456   };
457 
458   /**
459    * Converts a value in a AV Object into the appropriate representation.
460    * This is the JS equivalent of Java's AV.maybeReferenceAndEncode(Object)
461    * if seenObjects is falsey. Otherwise any AV.Objects not in
462    * seenObjects will be fully embedded rather than encoded
463    * as a pointer.  This array will be used to prevent going into an infinite
464    * loop because we have circular references.  If <seenObjects>
465    * is set, then none of the AV Objects that are serialized can be dirty.
466    */
467   AV._encode = function(value, seenObjects, disallowObjects) {
468     var _ = AV._;
469     if (value instanceof AV.Object) {
470       if (disallowObjects) {
471         throw "AV.Objects not allowed here";
472       }
473       if (!seenObjects || _.include(seenObjects, value) || !value._hasData) {
474         return value._toPointer();
475       }
476       if (!value.dirty()) {
477         seenObjects = seenObjects.concat(value);
478         return AV._encode(value._toFullJSON(seenObjects),
479                              seenObjects,
480                              disallowObjects);
481       }
482       throw "Tried to save an object with a pointer to a new, unsaved object.";
483     }
484     if (value instanceof AV.ACL) {
485       return value.toJSON();
486     }
487     if (_.isDate(value)) {
488       return { "__type": "Date", "iso": value.toJSON() };
489     }
490     if (value instanceof AV.GeoPoint) {
491       return value.toJSON();
492     }
493     if (_.isArray(value)) {
494       return _.map(value, function(x) {
495         return AV._encode(x, seenObjects, disallowObjects);
496       });
497     }
498     if (_.isRegExp(value)) {
499       return value.source;
500     }
501     if (value instanceof AV.Relation) {
502       return value.toJSON();
503     }
504     if (value instanceof AV.Op) {
505       return value.toJSON();
506     }
507     if (value instanceof AV.File) {
508       if (!value.url() && !value.id) {
509         throw "Tried to save an object containing an unsaved file.";
510       }
511       return {
512         __type: "File",
513         id:  value.id,
514         name: value.name(),
515         url: value.url()
516       };
517     }
518     if (_.isObject(value)) {
519       var output = {};
520       AV._objectEach(value, function(v, k) {
521         output[k] = AV._encode(v, seenObjects, disallowObjects);
522       });
523       return output;
524     }
525     return value;
526   };
527 
528   /**
529    * The inverse function of AV._encode.
530    * TODO: make decode not mutate value.
531    */
532   AV._decode = function(key, value) {
533     var _ = AV._;
534     if (!_.isObject(value)) {
535       return value;
536     }
537     if (_.isArray(value)) {
538       AV._arrayEach(value, function(v, k) {
539         value[k] = AV._decode(k, v);
540       });
541       return value;
542     }
543     if (value instanceof AV.Object) {
544       return value;
545     }
546     if (value instanceof AV.File) {
547       return value;
548     }
549     if (value instanceof AV.Op) {
550       return value;
551     }
552     if (value.__op) {
553       return AV.Op._decode(value);
554     }
555     if (value.__type === "Pointer") {
556       var className = value.className;
557       var pointer = AV.Object._create(className);
558       if(value.createdAt){
559           delete value.__type;
560           delete value.className;
561           pointer._finishFetch(value, true);
562       }else{
563           pointer._finishFetch({ objectId: value.objectId }, false);
564       }
565       return pointer;
566     }
567     if (value.__type === "Object") {
568       // It's an Object included in a query result.
569       var className = value.className;
570       delete value.__type;
571       delete value.className;
572       var object = AV.Object._create(className);
573       object._finishFetch(value, true);
574       return object;
575     }
576     if (value.__type === "Date") {
577       return AV._parseDate(value.iso);
578     }
579     if (value.__type === "GeoPoint") {
580       return new AV.GeoPoint({
581         latitude: value.latitude,
582         longitude: value.longitude
583       });
584     }
585     if (key === "ACL") {
586       if (value instanceof AV.ACL) {
587         return value;
588       }
589       return new AV.ACL(value);
590     }
591     if (value.__type === "Relation") {
592       var relation = new AV.Relation(null, key);
593       relation.targetClassName = value.className;
594       return relation;
595     }
596     if (value.__type === "File") {
597       var file = new AV.File(value.name);
598       file._metaData = value.metaData || {};
599       file._url = value.url;
600       file.id = value.objectId;
601       return file;
602     }
603     AV._objectEach(value, function(v, k) {
604       value[k] = AV._decode(k, v);
605     });
606     return value;
607   };
608 
609   AV._arrayEach = AV._.each;
610 
611   /**
612    * Does a deep traversal of every item in object, calling func on every one.
613    * @param {Object} object The object or array to traverse deeply.
614    * @param {Function} func The function to call for every item. It will
615    *     be passed the item as an argument. If it returns a truthy value, that
616    *     value will replace the item in its parent container.
617    * @returns {} the result of calling func on the top-level object itself.
618    */
619   AV._traverse = function(object, func, seen) {
620     if (object instanceof AV.Object) {
621       seen = seen || [];
622       if (AV._.indexOf(seen, object) >= 0) {
623         // We've already visited this object in this call.
624         return;
625       }
626       seen.push(object);
627       AV._traverse(object.attributes, func, seen);
628       return func(object);
629     }
630     if (object instanceof AV.Relation || object instanceof AV.File) {
631       // Nothing needs to be done, but we don't want to recurse into the
632       // object's parent infinitely, so we catch this case.
633       return func(object);
634     }
635     if (AV._.isArray(object)) {
636       AV._.each(object, function(child, index) {
637         var newChild = AV._traverse(child, func, seen);
638         if (newChild) {
639           object[index] = newChild;
640         }
641       });
642       return func(object);
643     }
644     if (AV._.isObject(object)) {
645       AV._each(object, function(child, key) {
646         var newChild = AV._traverse(child, func, seen);
647         if (newChild) {
648           object[key] = newChild;
649         }
650       });
651       return func(object);
652     }
653     return func(object);
654   };
655 
656   /**
657    * This is like _.each, except:
658    * * it doesn't work for so-called array-like objects,
659    * * it does work for dictionaries with a "length" attribute.
660    */
661   AV._objectEach = AV._each = function(obj, callback) {
662     var _ = AV._;
663     if (_.isObject(obj)) {
664       _.each(_.keys(obj), function(key) {
665         callback(obj[key], key);
666       });
667     } else {
668       _.each(obj, callback);
669     }
670   };
671 
672   // Helper function to check null or undefined.
673   AV._isNullOrUndefined = function(x) {
674     return AV._.isNull(x) || AV._.isUndefined(x);
675   };
676 };
677
